summary: This is an FBI 302 form documenting the interview of David Mullen, a former chef for Jeffrey Epstein. Mullen describes his employment, travel to Epstein's various properties, his interactions with Ghislaine Maxwell and other staff, and his observations of frequent massages involving young women at Epstein's residences. The interview concludes with agents confronting Mullen about inconsistencies with a prior statement.

persons.name: David Mullen
persons.context: Interviewed by the FBI about his employment with Jeffrey Epstein approximately 15 years prior. Described his duties, travel to Epstein's properties, and observations of massage appointments.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mullen's employer. Described as having residences in Manhattan, Palm Beach, on an island, at Zorro Ranch, and in Paris. Mullen cooked for him and his guests and observed frequent massage appointments.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Contacted and hired Mullen. Told him 'the ropes,' including dress code, conduct, and travel readiness. Was reported to by Mullen, but her presence diminished towards the end of his employment.

persons.name: Al Gore
persons.context: Former U.S. Vice President. Mullen stated he made lunch for him at one of Epstein's properties.

connections.description: Mullen was employed as Epstein's personal chef for approximately 1.5 years, traveling between his residences and cooking for him and his guests.
Maxwell contacted, interviewed, and hired Mullen. She was his direct supervisor, giving him instructions on conduct, dress, and schedule.
Maxwell acted as a manager for Epstein's household staff, including hiring the chef and conveying rules. Mullen understood she worked for/with Epstein.

events.title: FBI Interview of David Mullen
events.description: The FBI, along with AUSAs and a paralegal, interviewed David Mullen via video conference about his employment with Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Mullen's Employment with Epstein
events.description: David Mullen worked as Jeffrey Epstein's personal chef for approximately 1.5 years, traveling to his properties in New York, Florida, New Mexico, and the Caribbean.

keyFacts: David Mullen, Epstein's former chef, described a routine of frequent massage appointments for Epstein involving young women (aged 18-22, in his estimation) at the Palm Beach and New York residences.
Mullen stated he was instructed by Ghislaine Maxwell and other staff not to interact with guests, to be ready to travel or cook at any time, and that he would be fired if late.
Mullen cooked for high-profile guests including former Vice President Al Gore and a former Prime Minister of Israel.
The FBI interviewers confronted Mullen about inconsistencies between this 2020 interview and a prior interview he gave to the FBI, leading him to request counsel and end the interview.
Mullen observed an appointment book kept by a phone in the kitchen used to track daily schedules, including massage appointments.
